com.apriori.choice

Class Either<A,B>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.choice.Either<A,B>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the type of the first choice
    B - the type of the second choice
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Choice<A,B>, Choice.OfTwo<A,B>

    public abstract class Either<A,B>
extends Object
implements Choice.OfTwo<A,B>
    A choice between one of two options, neither of which can be null. Either the first or second option will be present -- never both and never neither. The option that is present will never be null.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.apriori.choice.Choice

        Choice.OfFive<A,B,C,D,E>, Choice.OfFour<A,B,C,D>, Choice.OfThree<A,B,C>, Choice.OfTwo<A,B>, Choice.Ops3<A,B,C>, Choice.Ops4<A,B,C,D>, Choice.Ops5<A,B,C,D,E>, Choice.VisitorOfFive<A,B,C,D,E,R>, Choice.VisitorOfFour<A,B,C,D,R>, Choice.VisitorOfThree<A,B,C,R>, Choice.VisitorOfTwo<A,B,R>

      • of

        public static <A,B> Either<A,B> of(A a,
                                   B b)
        Constructs an object with the given values. Exactly one of the given values must be non-null. If the first value is non-null, an object whose first choice is present is returned. Otherwise, an object whose second choice is present is returned.
        Parameters:
        a - the value of the first choice
        b - the value of the second choice
        Returns:
        either the first or second value, depending on which is non-null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if both arguments are null or if neither is

      • firstOf

        public static <A,B> Either<A,B> firstOf(A a,
                                        B b)
        Constructs an object using the first of the given values that is non-null. At least one of the given values must be non-null. If the first value is non-null, an object whose first choice is present is returned. Otherwise, an object whose second choice is present is returned.
        Parameters:
        a - the value of the first choice
        b - the value of the second choice
        Returns:
        either the first value if it is non-null or the second value otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if both arguments are null

      • mapFirst

        public abstract <T> Either<T,B> mapFirst(Function<? super A,? extends T> function)
        Description copied from interface: Choice
        Transforms the value of the first option. If the first option is not present, this effectively does nothing. If the first option is present, the given function is applied to its value and a new choice is returned whose first option is the function's result.
        Specified by:
        mapFirst in interface Choice<A,B>
        Specified by:
        mapFirst in interface Choice.OfTwo<A,B>
        Parameters:
        function - the function to apply to the first option
        Returns:
        a choice with the first option, it it was present, transformed by applying the given function to it
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the function is invoked and returns null

      • mapSecond

        public abstract <T> Either<A,T> mapSecond(Function<? super B,? extends T> function)
        Description copied from interface: Choice
        Transforms the value of the second option. If the second option is not present, this effectively does nothing. If the second option is present, the given function is applied to its value and a new choice is returned whose second option is the function's result.
        Specified by:
        mapSecond in interface Choice<A,B>
        Specified by:
        mapSecond in interface Choice.OfTwo<A,B>
        Parameters:
        function - the function to apply to the second option
        Returns:
        a choice with the second option, it it was present, transformed by applying the given function to it
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the function is invoked and returns null

      • expandFirst

        public abstract <C> AnyOfThree<C,A,B> expandFirst()
        Description copied from interface: Choice.OfTwo
        Expands this choice of two options into a choice of three options whose first option is never present. The new choice will have the same value as this choice. Whichever option is present in this choice will have its position shifted to the corresponding option of the new choice.
        Specified by:
        expandFirst in interface Choice.OfTwo<A,B>
        Returns:
        a choice of three options with the same value as this and whose first option is never present

      • expandSecond

        public abstract <C> AnyOfThree<A,C,B> expandSecond()
        Description copied from interface: Choice.OfTwo
        Expands this choice of two options into a choice of three options whose second option is never present. The new choice will have the same value as this choice. Whichever option is present in this choice will have its position shifted to the corresponding option of the new choice.
        Specified by:
        expandSecond in interface Choice.OfTwo<A,B>
        Returns:
        a choice of three options with the same value as this and whose second option is never present

      • expandThird

        public abstract <C> AnyOfThree<A,B,C> expandThird()
        Description copied from interface: Choice.OfTwo
        Expands this choice of two options into a choice of three options whose third option is never present. The new choice will have the same value as this choice. Whichever option is present in this choice will also be present in the new choice.
        Specified by:
        expandThird in interface Choice.OfTwo<A,B>
        Returns:
        a choice of three options with the same value as this and whose third option is never present

      • swap

        public abstract Either<B,A> swap()
        Returns a new object with the same choice present as this object, but with positions swapped. So if this object has the first choice present, the returned object has the second choice present, and vice versa.
        Returns:
        a new object with the first and second choices in swapped positions

      • exchangeFirst

        public abstract Either<A,B> exchangeFirst(Function<? super A,? extends B> function)
        Exchanges an object with its first option present for one with its second option present. If this option has the second option present, it is returned unchanged. The given function is used to "exchange" the first option, if present, for a value whose type is that of the second option.
        Parameters:
        function - a function that exchanges the first option, if present, for a value of the same type as the second option
        Returns:
        a new object with its second option present, after exchanging the first option if necessary
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the function is invoked and returns null
        See Also:
        exchangeSecond(Function)

      • exchangeSecond

        public abstract Either<A,B> exchangeSecond(Function<? super B,? extends A> function)
        Exchanges an object with its second option present for one with its first option present. If this option has the first option present, it is returned unchanged. The given function is used to "exchange" the second option, if present, for a value whose type is that of the first option.
        Parameters:
        function - a function that exchanges the second option, if present, for a value of the same type as the first option
        Returns:
        a new object with its first option present, after exchanging the second option if necessary

      • contractFirst

        public abstract B contractFirst(Function<? super A,? extends B> function)
        Contracts this choice from two options to one by removing the first option. If the first option is present, the given function is used to compute a new value of the correct type.
        Parameters:
        function - a function that accepts the first option, if present, and computes a value with the same type as the second option
        Returns:
        the value of the second option if present, otherwise the result of applying the given function to the value of the first option

      • contractSecond

        public abstract A contractSecond(Function<? super B,? extends A> function)
        Contracts this choice from two options to one by removing the second option. If the second option is present, the given function is used to compute a new value of the correct type.
        Parameters:
        function - a function that accepts the second option, if present, and computes a value with the same type as the first option
        Returns:
        the value of the first option if present, otherwise the result of applying the given function to the value of the second option

      • flatMapFirst

        public abstract Either<A,B> flatMapFirst(Function<? super A,Either<A,B>> function)
        Maps the value of the first option, if present, to a new choice. If this option has its second option present, it is returned unchanged. Otherwise, the given function is applied to the value of the first option to produce a new choice.
        Parameters:
        function - a function that accepts the first option, if present, and computes a new choice
        Returns:
        the current choice if the second option is present, or the result of applying the given function to the value of the first option

      • flatMapSecond

        public abstract Either<A,B> flatMapSecond(Function<? super B,Either<A,B>> function)
        Maps the value of the second option, if present, to a new choice. If this option has its first option present, it is returned unchanged. Otherwise, the given function is applied to the value of the second option to produce a new choice.
        Parameters:
        function - a function that accepts the second option, if present, and computes a new choice
        Returns:
        the current choice if the first option is present, or the result of applying the given function to the value of the second option
